<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" media="screen" href="/~d/styles/rss2full.xsl"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/css" media="screen" href="http://rss.csmonitor.com/~d/styles/itemcontent.css"?><rss xmlns:feedburner="http://rssnamespace.org/feedburner/ext/1.0" version="2.0"><channel><title>Christian Science Monitor | USA</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/</link><description>Stay up to date with the latest USA news; subscribe to the Monitor's RSS feeds!</description><language>en</language><feedburner:info uri="feeds/usa" /><atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="hub" href="http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/" /><atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" href="http://www.csmonitor.com/rss/usa.rss" /><feedburner:feedFlare href="https://add.my.yahoo.com/rss?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.csmonitor.com%2Frss%2Fusa.rss" src="http://us.i1.yimg.com/us.yimg.com/i/us/my/addtomyyahoo4.gif">Subscribe with My Yahoo!</feedburner:feedFlare><feedburner:feedFlare href="http://www.bloglines.com/sub/http://www.csmonitor.com/rss/usa.rss" src="http://www.bloglines.com/images/sub_modern11.gif">Subscribe with Bloglines</feedburner:feedFlare><feedburner:feedFlare href="http://www.netvibes.com/subscribe.php?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.csmonitor.com%2Frss%2Fusa.rss" src="//www.netvibes.com/img/add2netvibes.gif">Subscribe with Netvibes</feedburner:feedFlare><feedburner:browserFriendly>This is a feed from The Christian Science Monitor that allows you to get automatic updates on the news published at csmonitor.com. There's a list of all RSS feeds from the Monitor at csmonitor.com/rss</feedburner:browserFriendly><item><title>The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0216/The-stark-message-behind-Mueller-indictment-of-13-Russians</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0216/The-stark-message-behind-Mueller-indictment-of-13-Russians</guid><description><p>The Russian nationals, as well as three Russian organizations, were charged with meddling in the 2016 US election.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/3tg8FUmqcm0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>As Mueller moves forward, lingering questions about Comey and Clinton</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0216/As-Mueller-moves-forward-lingering-questions-about-Comey-and-Clinton</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0216/As-Mueller-moves-forward-lingering-questions-about-Comey-and-Clinton</guid><description><p>A review of the investigation into Hillary Clinton’s use of a private email server is expected to be released soon by the Department of Justice’s inspector general. It may help answer growing questions among Republicans about possible bias at the FBI – and shed light on the origins of the Trump-Russia probe.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/U7l079IyeMs" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Black and Latino mortgage borrowers still face subtle discrimination at the bank</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Black-and-Latino-mortgage-borrowers-still-face-subtle-discrimination-at-the-bank</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Black-and-Latino-mortgage-borrowers-still-face-subtle-discrimination-at-the-bank</guid><description><p>Congress originally passed the Community Reinvestment Act as a way to fight urban lending discrimination. But despite following the act's regulations, many banks continue to employ lending practices that reinforce racial disparities.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/J9cw4CAZIwU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Capitol Hill reaction to Florida shooting follows a familiar script</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Capitol-Hill-reaction-to-Florida-shooting-follows-a-familiar-script</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Capitol-Hill-reaction-to-Florida-shooting-follows-a-familiar-script</guid><description><p>In the wake of the shooting at a high school in Florida, many Democrats in Congress call for tighter gun laws, while Republicans emphasize mental health.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/UaAeXUOBzwI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Six boys who survived the Florida shooting find strength in friendship</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Six-boys-who-survived-the-Florida-shooting-find-strength-in-friendship</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Six-boys-who-survived-the-Florida-shooting-find-strength-in-friendship</guid><description><p>A group of high school students, who lived through the school shooting in Parkland, Fla., on Feb. 14, say their connection is their key to finding a way to move forward.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/OKeo38hJZXY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Utah County Jail culinary program provides skills, bridges divides</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Utah-County-Jail-culinary-program-provides-skills-bridges-divides</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0216/Utah-County-Jail-culinary-program-provides-skills-bridges-divides</guid><description><p>A culinary program at the Utah County Jail employs inmates in the jail's commercial kitchen, aiming to change behavior, provide employable skills, and bridge divides between law enforcement and inmates.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/zhiSgpPw2CA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Will Holder run for president in 2020?</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0215/Will-Holder-run-for-president-in-2020</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0215/Will-Holder-run-for-president-in-2020</guid><description><p>When former Attorney General Eric Holder recently came to a Monitor Breakfast, he seemed to enjoy himself so much that he made news.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/XmKBpIc418Q" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>At crossroads of policing and murder, a long push for accountability</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/At-crossroads-of-policing-and-murder-a-long-push-for-accountability</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/At-crossroads-of-policing-and-murder-a-long-push-for-accountability</guid><description><p>The game began to change in many ways in New York because of the relentless work of the city's community of activists. They are pushing for what they see is a common-sense system of transparency for officers. <i>Part 2 of 2.&nbsp;</i></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/RkGBBkm09BU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Florida school shooting: Does 'national emergency' warrant national response?</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/Florida-school-shooting-Does-national-emergency-warrant-national-response</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/Florida-school-shooting-Does-national-emergency-warrant-national-response</guid><description><p>In the wake of another school shooting, Americans are grasping for a way forward. Many are calling for action from federal legislators. Others say a more distinct sense of common responsibility and communal burden may be more effective.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/QR3Vr8lLtEg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Albuquerque rethinks approach to often-absent elementary students</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0215/Albuquerque-rethinks-approach-to-often-absent-elementary-students</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0215/Albuquerque-rethinks-approach-to-often-absent-elementary-students</guid><description><p>Absenteeism in the younger grades, where students largely rely on parents to get them to school, can be a product of poverty. In Albuquerque, N.M., and elsewhere, schools are starting to track attendance student-by-student to better target support.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/SdAItFip-A0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Judge brings officials, lawyers to soon-to-be-closed homeless camp</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/Judge-brings-officials-lawyers-to-soon-to-be-closed-homeless-camp</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0215/Judge-brings-officials-lawyers-to-soon-to-be-closed-homeless-camp</guid><description><p>Known for an unconventional style, the Southern California judge brought lawyers and government officials to the two-mile long riverbed encampment to talk to residents about a plan he is overseeing to move them to motel rooms and other short-term housing.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/nhEtFsOvaM4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Troubled teen charged in deadly Florida school shooting</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0215/Troubled-teen-charged-in-deadly-Florida-school-shooting</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0215/Troubled-teen-charged-in-deadly-Florida-school-shooting</guid><description><p>An orphaned teenager in Parkland, Fla., open-fired in a high school with a semi-automatic weapon, killing 17, in the deadliest school shooting since Newtown, Conn., in 2012.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/ScCWZ5f4KA8" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Why so many temporary White House clearances? Adam Schiff wants to know.</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0214/Why-so-many-temporary-White-House-clearances-Adam-Schiff-wants-to-know</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0214/Why-so-many-temporary-White-House-clearances-Adam-Schiff-wants-to-know</guid><description><p>President Trump is a manager who appears to thrive on chaos and doesn't sweat details. But in the Rob Porter episode that ethos has run into the by-the-book tradition of security checks. Congressional leaders including Adam Schiff (D) are raising concerns.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/K6kbZ2-HAWg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>A tale of two cities and murder</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0214/A-tale-of-two-cities-and-murder</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0214/A-tale-of-two-cities-and-murder</guid><description><p>Last year, New York saw its lowest murder rate since it began keeping modern records in the 1950s. Baltimore saw its highest in history. With numbers so stark, the stories these two cities tell invite an obvious question: Why?<i>&nbsp;Part 1 of 2.</i></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/ZC2y2nZ9Nuw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Real immigration debate? New senators schooled in how work got done.</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0213/Real-immigration-debate-New-senators-schooled-in-how-work-got-done</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0213/Real-immigration-debate-New-senators-schooled-in-how-work-got-done</guid><description><p>Thanks to a promise McConnell made to get a budget deal, the Senate is enjoying the revival of a nearly forgotten legislative process: open debate. But that may not make immigration any less of a problematic issue.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/j_eM-Jd1VH0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Urban renewal with a conservative flair</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0213/Urban-renewal-with-a-conservative-flair</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0213/Urban-renewal-with-a-conservative-flair</guid><description><p>Oklahoma City – one of just a handful of big US cities run by a Republican mayor – has taken a unique approach to revitalizing its downtown, relying on public-private partnerships, paying for projects as it goes, and doing it debt-free.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/s4jPsxm9DII" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Opioid companies paid advocacy groups $10 million</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Opioid-companies-paid-advocacy-groups-10-million</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Opioid-companies-paid-advocacy-groups-10-million</guid><description><p>Companies selling opioids spent more than $10 million&nbsp;between 2012 to 2017&nbsp;to support advocacy groups that promoted their use, according to a recent US Senate report.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/QIkRIi8op38" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Revised federal housing subsidies offer mobility to low-income residents</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Revised-federal-housing-subsidies-offer-mobility-to-low-income-residents</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Revised-federal-housing-subsidies-offer-mobility-to-low-income-residents</guid><description><p>Following a court ruling in December, housing subsidies will now be allocated based on the average rent of ZIP Codes, not entire metropolitan areas. The change provides greater access to higher-cost neighborhoods, which experts say could help fight segregation.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/STjBbEVd6wQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Seattle proposes taller, denser apartments in affordable housing plan</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Seattle-proposes-taller-denser-apartments-in-affordable-housing-plan</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0213/Seattle-proposes-taller-denser-apartments-in-affordable-housing-plan</guid><description><p>Supporters say the affordable housing plan will enable middle- and working-class families to stay in the city as tech industry growth fuels rapid real estate development.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/E44SONsL-S4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Virtual reality brings deep-sea diving and the farm to the classroom</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0213/Virtual-reality-brings-deep-sea-diving-and-the-farm-to-the-classroom</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0213/Virtual-reality-brings-deep-sea-diving-and-the-farm-to-the-classroom</guid><description><p>Simulated field trips with the use of a virtual reality headset means students can be exploring the boreal forest one day and observing animals the next – without long bus rides. Although still relatively rare in schools, VR technology is increasingly more accessible and affordable.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/Aayhi8ugddI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Why GOP is largely silent over Trump's deficit-heavy budget</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0212/Why-GOP-is-largely-silent-over-Trump-s-deficit-heavy-budget</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0212/Why-GOP-is-largely-silent-over-Trump-s-deficit-heavy-budget</guid><description><p>President Trump has led the Republican Party in surprising directions – away from a balanced federal budget being only the latest. A recent poll indicates that's not a concern to most voters.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/QfrEzZr4sLo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>As a year on the mainland ends, Puerto Rican college students consider return</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/As-a-year-on-the-mainland-ends-Puerto-Rican-college-students-consider-return</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/As-a-year-on-the-mainland-ends-Puerto-Rican-college-students-consider-return</guid><description><p>Following the damages of hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico, several mainland universities offered free or reduced tuition for a year to the island's college students. Now in their spring semester, these visiting students are evaluating what awaits them back in Puerto Rico.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/4muZHaW8m-0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Fiscal stimulus is back. So are bigger deficits.</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0212/Fiscal-stimulus-is-back.-So-are-bigger-deficits</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0212/Fiscal-stimulus-is-back.-So-are-bigger-deficits</guid><description><p>A rapid increase in federal debt is likely to push up interest rates and risk choking the current economic expansion. This could lead to a reckoning when debt payments start to pile up after 2019.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/mRnkPqzCZ6s" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Florida bill would offer private school vouchers to bullied students</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/Florida-bill-would-offer-private-school-vouchers-to-bullied-students</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/Florida-bill-would-offer-private-school-vouchers-to-bullied-students</guid><description><p>A proposed Florida bill would offer students who've been bullied a voucher for private school. Supporters of the bill say this program would offer students hope and a safe path to education, while opponents see the move as an attack on the public school system.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/XzUnMZZJ5HI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>More than a third of all US ex-cons who can’t vote live in Florida. Why?</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0212/More-than-a-third-of-all-US-ex-cons-who-can-t-vote-live-in-Florida.-Why</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Justice/2018/0212/More-than-a-third-of-all-US-ex-cons-who-can-t-vote-live-in-Florida.-Why</guid><description><p>A judge found that the vote restoration process in Florida used arbitrary means to decide who is worthy. The state has until Feb. 12 to come up with remedies to the constitutional violations.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/KHYvUCPClIU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Fishing lures hook Ohio high school on personalized learning</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/Fishing-lures-hook-Ohio-high-school-on-personalized-learning</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0212/Fishing-lures-hook-Ohio-high-school-on-personalized-learning</guid><description><p>In a small Ohio town, a high school built a program around fishing lures to give students a taste of entrepreneurship by focusing on their individual needs and&nbsp;leveraging community traditions.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/I0vnOJBH-cw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Controversy in Latino American organization reflects evolving political landscape</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0209/Controversy-in-Latino-American-organization-reflects-evolving-political-landscape</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0209/Controversy-in-Latino-American-organization-reflects-evolving-political-landscape</guid><description><p>The League of United Latin American Citizens (LULAC) has called on their president, Roger Rocha, to resign after Mr. Rocha praised President Trump's immigration plan. LULAC has historically supported immigration control, but its political demographics are changing.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/t6JM0JbKeag" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Trump signs budget bill, ending overnight shutdown</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0209/Trump-signs-budget-bill-ending-overnight-shutdown</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0209/Trump-signs-budget-bill-ending-overnight-shutdown</guid><description><p>The five-and-a-half hour federal freeze ended with President Trump signing a $400 billion budget deal, passed in the Senate and the House despite opposition from tea party conservatives and&nbsp;liberal Democrats.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/ld-CJOOLHWc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>A graduation crisis in D.C. brings questions of ethics to the fore</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0209/A-graduation-crisis-in-D.C.-brings-questions-of-ethics-to-the-fore</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0209/A-graduation-crisis-in-D.C.-brings-questions-of-ethics-to-the-fore</guid><description><p>One-third of the district's 2017 graduating class was found to have attendance and/or credit violations. Observers say the problem goes beyond D.C., and suggest that more support is needed for struggling students and educators who grade and promote them.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/iaJDQvXl84Q" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>'Calls From Home': How one Kentucky radio station connects inmates and families</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0209/Calls-From-Home-How-one-Kentucky-radio-station-connects-inmates-and-families</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0209/Calls-From-Home-How-one-Kentucky-radio-station-connects-inmates-and-families</guid><description><p>Every week, WMMT broadcasts recorded messages from friends and family members of the more than 5,000 men incarcerated in the six federal and state prisons within range of Whitesburg, Ky.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/_B2OnYTlOwI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Rollercoaster ride continues: Dow industrials drop another 1,000 points</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0208/Rollercoaster-ride-continues-Dow-industrials-drop-another-1-000-points</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0208/Rollercoaster-ride-continues-Dow-industrials-drop-another-1-000-points</guid><description><p>Investors are worried about inflation and corporate profits as workers' wages rise, analysts say, triggering a selling spree for stocks in technology companies, banks, retailers, travel companies, and homebuilders.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/TEYpL9bzo18" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>On cusp of budget deal, Congress far from functional</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0208/On-cusp-of-budget-deal-Congress-far-from-functional</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0208/On-cusp-of-budget-deal-Congress-far-from-functional</guid><description><p>The extreme efforts involved in simply passing a budget, the most basic job for lawmakers, underscore how broken the process has become on Capitol Hill – a place many members now describe as frustrating and joyless.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/WEZ-phugPyA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Mexico takes the battle for gender respect to the classroom</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0208/Mexico-takes-the-battle-for-gender-respect-to-the-classroom</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/EqualEd/2018/0208/Mexico-takes-the-battle-for-gender-respect-to-the-classroom</guid><description><p>Incidents of 'machismo' – experienced everywhere from streets to schools – combined with growing violence against women, are&nbsp;lending urgency to&nbsp;calls for discussion around gender relations.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/xTWVudA_EMA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Record number of transgender candidates enter 2018 elections</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0208/Record-number-of-transgender-candidates-enter-2018-elections</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0208/Record-number-of-transgender-candidates-enter-2018-elections</guid><description><p>An estimated 40 transgender candidates plan to run for office in the upcoming mid-term elections, signaling a tidal shift in LGBT representation in government. Many candidates cite what they see as anti-LGBT policies from the White House as motivation to run.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/s4phPWPXATA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>New billionaire L.A. Times owner inspires mix of hope and concern</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0208/New-billionaire-L.A.-Times-owner-inspires-mix-of-hope-and-concern</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0208/New-billionaire-L.A.-Times-owner-inspires-mix-of-hope-and-concern</guid><description><p>The latest in a growing trend of powerful business executives buying newspapers, biotech CEO Patrick Soon-Shiong has purchased the Los Angeles Times. The deal coincides with a period of intense change for the paper, whose journalists have just voted to form a union.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/HxB5VNeZ6m4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Memo wars: When secrets get out, what happens next?</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0207/Memo-wars-When-secrets-get-out-what-happens-next</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0207/Memo-wars-When-secrets-get-out-what-happens-next</guid><description><p>The release of the Nunes memo and its Democratic rebuttal have the potential to chill relations between the intelligence community and Capitol Hill, make allied intelligence agencies wary about sharing secrets, and amp up demands by defendants to use FISA documents in their trials.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/z8AkGF4IAq4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>In Democrats' strategic strike against gerrymandering, Holder leads the charge</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0207/In-Democrats-strategic-strike-against-gerrymandering-Holder-leads-the-charge</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/monitor_breakfast/2018/0207/In-Democrats-strategic-strike-against-gerrymandering-Holder-leads-the-charge</guid><description><p>At a breakfast for reporters hosted by The Christian Science Monitor, former Attorney General Eric Holder calls political gerrymandering 'a fundamental affront to our system of democracy.' He's heading a Democratic effort that seeks a more level playing field well beyond the next elections.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/h1u3aFMaxmE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>US reexamines cybersecurity after Russian hack</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Military/2018/0207/US-reexamines-cybersecurity-after-Russian-hack</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Military/2018/0207/US-reexamines-cybersecurity-after-Russian-hack</guid><description><p>Russian hackers attacked at least 87 people working on advanced US defense technology including drones and rockets, according to an Associated Press investigation. The hackers, identified by the moniker 'Fancy Bear,' largely targeted personal Gmail accounts.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/jHtq1_3Q7Eo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Town library starts newspaper after local paper shuttered</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0207/Town-library-starts-newspaper-after-local-paper-shuttered</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0207/Town-library-starts-newspaper-after-local-paper-shuttered</guid><description><p>A small New Hampshire town library offers a model of how others can step in to provide information for communities in 'news deserts.'</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/ciWctZiElho" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Even in his absence, McCain’s influence is strongly felt</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0206/Even-in-his-absence-McCain-s-influence-is-strongly-felt</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0206/Even-in-his-absence-McCain-s-influence-is-strongly-felt</guid><description><p>From his home in Arizona, GOP Sen. John McCain has maintained his voice on Capitol Hill – in part through a new generation of senators he’s mentored.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/A7BtSvfAis4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Chicago's planned school closures met with skepticism</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0206/Chicago-s-planned-school-closures-met-with-skepticism</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Education/2018/0206/Chicago-s-planned-school-closures-met-with-skepticism</guid><description><p>Some parents, students, and activists, still dealing with the fallout from 2013 closures, fear that the plan will displace hundreds of mostly black and poor students. Closures have long been a method for cities to deal with underperforming schools, but research shows mixed results.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/9CpZAPYTDq0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Can alt-weeklies write a future for themselves in a digital era?</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0206/Can-alt-weeklies-write-a-future-for-themselves-in-a-digital-era</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Society/2018/0206/Can-alt-weeklies-write-a-future-for-themselves-in-a-digital-era</guid><description><p>Just last week, Nashville's The Scene shuttered. In 2017, the Baltimore City paper folded, the LA Weekly cut most of its editorial staff, and the Village Voice axed print. But supporters say the need remains for vigilant reporters intensely focused on local news.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/kWlRauIBUu4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>College gymnastics meet offers hope, support in wake of Nassar abuse</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Sports/2018/0206/College-gymnastics-meet-offers-hope-support-in-wake-of-Nassar-abuse</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Sports/2018/0206/College-gymnastics-meet-offers-hope-support-in-wake-of-Nassar-abuse</guid><description><p>Two college coaches decided they wanted to send a national message: Their sport is not defined by the misdeeds of one man but by the strength of athletes who refuse to be defined by the abuses they suffered.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/jrnJrn4xqX8" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Dow nosedives 1,175 points, the worst day for stocks since 2011</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/Dow-nosedives-1-175-points-the-worst-day-for-stocks-since-2011</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/Dow-nosedives-1-175-points-the-worst-day-for-stocks-since-2011</guid><description><p>Health care, technology, and industrial companies all took outsize losses and energy companies sank with oil prices. Analysts say after big market gains in 2017 stocks were overdue for a drop.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/trm3ZtsDI84" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>In big week for Brexit, battle deepens over the costs of 'opting out'</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Foreign-Policy/2018/0205/In-big-week-for-Brexit-battle-deepens-over-the-costs-of-opting-out</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Foreign-Policy/2018/0205/In-big-week-for-Brexit-battle-deepens-over-the-costs-of-opting-out</guid><description><p>Today we launch Patterns, a biweekly column that will look at the points of connection in what often seems like a chaotic world. Our first target: the difficult bid to reshape Britain's relationship with the European Union.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/lweV8QIorHc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>US begins gradual drawdown of troops from Iraq</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Military/2018/0205/US-begins-gradual-drawdown-of-troops-from-Iraq</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Military/2018/0205/US-begins-gradual-drawdown-of-troops-from-Iraq</guid><description><p>Following Baghdad's declaration of victory over ISIS last year, American troops have begun to filter out of Iraq. The move comes with the release of the Pentagon's National Defense Strategy that cited China and Russia as growing national security priorities.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/bRQjGrR_WXY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>In a small west Texas high school, boys and girls join to form one basketball team</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/In-a-small-west-Texas-high-school-boys-and-girls-join-to-form-one-basketball-team</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/In-a-small-west-Texas-high-school-boys-and-girls-join-to-form-one-basketball-team</guid><description><p>Dwindling enrollment and injuries led a high school in the town of Welch, Texas – population 222 – to consolidate the girls and boys&nbsp; teams.&nbsp;They may be teaching competitors lessons about acceptance and respect, but deep down they just want to play basketball.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/XOnnK2W9O68" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Local governments move to ban bump stocks in wake of Las Vegas shooting</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/Local-governments-move-to-ban-bump-stocks-in-wake-of-Las-Vegas-shooting</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/2018/0205/Local-governments-move-to-ban-bump-stocks-in-wake-of-Las-Vegas-shooting</guid><description><p>Two states and two cities so far have enacted laws to ban bump stocks, a device used by the Las Vegas shooter, after inaction at the federal level. However, gun-rights advocates say these efforts undermine the Second Amendment and will do little to stop criminals.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/DZ_ZkswI_oE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Republican memo released with support of Trump</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0202/Republican-memo-released-with-support-of-Trump</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0202/Republican-memo-released-with-support-of-Trump</guid><description><p>A classified memo prepared by House Republicans accusing the FBI of misconduct regarding the investigation into connections between the Trump campaign and Russia was released despite objections from the Justice Department.</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/pF6HS3gno9s" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item><item><title>Voters with disabilities face barriers to voting</title><link>http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0202/Voters-with-disabilities-face-barriers-to-voting</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/Politics/2018/0202/Voters-with-disabilities-face-barriers-to-voting</guid><description><p>Millions of voting-age Americans with disabilities face numerous obstacles to cast their ballots in elections, including a recent return to paper ballots, poorly trained poll workers, and physically inaccessible polling places.&nbsp;</p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/feeds/usa/~4/WeN1kZCdB7s" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description></item></channel></rss>
